item.title: Dockerized Cranvas
item.description: TLDR: The legendary Cranvas dataviz library, now in a Docker container. Interactive statistical graphics are incredibly useful both as an Interactive Exploartory Data Analysis (IEDA) tool and as a visual ‘debugger’ for building machine learning models and complex data science products such as search/recommenders, text tagging, custom playlist generators, etc. Unfortunately, it’s also somewhat of a lost art, and while modern interactive graphics alternatives exist via interactive Shiny plots, linked Plotly graphics, etc, in my experience none have approached the power, simplicity, and performance provided by Cranvas’s old-school (Desktop/Qt) linked IEDA primitives.
